entries.author: miguel_prz
entries.text: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.
entries.title: NICEPERL's lists

entries.author: tom_wyant
entries.text: Tom was recently granted co-maint on DateTime::Calendar::Christian and has done a developer release, the first release in 13 years. He'd like feedback from anyone with an interest in it.
entries.title: DateTime::Calendar::Christian updated

entries.author: doug_bell
entries.text: Doug has put out a developer release of Log::Any, and is hoping people will try it out and let him know if they have any problems.
entries.title: Log::Any 1.044-TRIAL released

entries.author: sawyer_x
entries.text: Two weeks' summaries for the price of one!
entries.title: Perl 5 Porters Mailing List Summary: October 18th - 31st

entries.author: max_maischein
entries.text: Max has been playing with OpenGL and GLEW (The OpenGL Extension Wrangler Library) from Perl. Also see his follow-up post.
entries.title: Modern OpenGL with Perl

entries.author: curtis_ovid_poe
entries.text: Ovid found it hard to find out what SQL was being run by DBIx::Class, and showed how he does it. In the comments you'll see that there's an easier, but perhaps hard to discover in the documentation, way to do it.
entries.title: Seeing the SQL in DBIx::Class

entries.author: liztormato
entries.text: The usual round-up of Perl 6 news.
entries.title: 2016.44 Увод в Perl 6

entries.author: ken_youens_clark
entries.text: Ken shows his parser for the FASTQ format in Perl 6.
entries.title: FASTQ read-pairer

entries.author: pawel_murias
entries.text: A brief progress report on the Rakudo.js project.
entries.title: Short Rakudo.js update

entries.author: moritz_lenz
entries.text: The Perl 6 Advent Calendar is looking for volunteers to write entries.
entries.title: Perl 6 Advent Calendar 2016 -- Call for Authors

entries.author: michael_stevenson
entries.text: A recounting of the part Perl played in the early days of the dynamic web.
entries.title: Perl and the birth of the dynamic web

entries.author: tom_radcliffe
entries.text: Tom goes through some of the reasons why Perl is still alive and kicking.
entries.title: Perl might be old school, but it continues to attract new users

entries.author: ruth_bavousett
entries.text: Ruth wrote a short piece about Gabor's list of tech conferences.
entries.title: A new directory of open source technology events

entries.author: tony_arcieri
entries.text: An attempt to address some of the shortcoming in JSON, some of which you may have read about it "Parsing JSON is a minefield".
entries.title: Introducing TJSON, a stricter, typed form of JSON

entries.text: A step-by-step guide on contributing to someone else's project on GitHub.
entries.title: How to contribute to an open source project on GitHub

header:
Maybe everyone's absorbed with the US Presidential election,
and hasn't had time to blog?
Hopefully in two short days normal service will have been resumed.
subject: A quiet week in Perl land
